gameplay

Class PowerUps

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.PowerUps
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PowerUps
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    The PowerUps class deals with the powerup logic depending on the current level.

    Author:
    Rakinul Huq
    See Also:
    Player, Serialized Form

      • PowerUps

        public PowerUps(Grid grid,
                Level level)
        PowerUps constructor
        Parameters:
        grid - is the grid that we place the powerups on
        level - is required to get which level the player is in

      • PowerUps

        public PowerUps(Grid grid,
                Player player,
                Level level)

        Constructor that initializes a PowerUps object that

        Parameters:
        grid - an object of Grid which contains the game's map and required methods access and alter it.
        player - an object of Player is the player that will be given the powerup if he gets it
        level - an object of Level which contains the required information about the level.

    • Method Detail

      • givePowerUp

        public void givePowerUp()
        Method that gives the player the necessary PowerUp depending on which level the player is on. This method compares which level the player is playing, and according to that gives the required PowerUp to the player.

      • randInt

        public static int randInt(int min,
                          int max)
        Given two integers, min and max, this method will return a pseudo-random integer value contained between these two integers.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum value which may be returned.
        max - Maximum value which may be returned.
        Returns:
        An integer between min and max inclusively.
